"The Interpreter" is a 2005 American crime thriller film directed by Tony Scott. The movie stars Melvin Van Peebles, Robert Prosky, Art Carney, Sven- Ole Thorsen, Tom Noonan, Tom Noonan, Tina Turner, Damon Wayans, Joan Plowright, Joan Plowwright, Jim Belushi, Ian McKellen, Danny DeVito, F. Murray Abraham, Noah Emmerich.

The movie tells the story of an interpreter who overhears an assassination plot while working for the United Nations in New York City. The interpreter, played by Melvin Van Peebles, realizes that he has stumbled upon a dangerous situation, and begins to work with the Secret Service agents (played by Robert Forster, Rick Yune, Gerard Butler, Gerard Butler, Cole Hauser, Morgan Freeman, Morgan Freeman) working at the White House in Washington D.C. to help contain and deal with the situation.

The movie also stars Radha Mitchell, Jesse Garcia, Kate del Castillo, America Ferrera, Eugenio Derbez, Eugenio Derbez, and many other talented actors and actresses.

The movie tells the story of John Nash, a brilliant mathematician who made groundbreaking discoveries early in his career. However, John's life took an unexpected turn when he was diagnosed with paranoid schizophrenia. Despite this diagnosis, John continued to make groundbreaking discoveries in mathematics and other fields. Finally, in 2006, John Nash received the Nobel Prize in Economic Sciences for his contributions to the development of game theory.
